overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a pragmatic approach to time-series forecasting under data constraints, starting with advanced model considerations (e.g., Holt-Winters, SARIMA) but ultimately selecting simple averaging due to limited historical data (96 points). The analysis prioritizes daily seasonality and handles data completeness, though it acknowledges limitations in capturing weekly patterns or trends. Forecasts are generated by repeating averaged hourly patterns across the prediction horizon.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided data
Peak values in evening (20:00-21:00) and afternoon dips
key_insights: Prioritization of daily patterns over weekly effects due to insufficient data (only 4 days)
Explicit handling of data limitations (small dataset constraining model choice)
Hourly averaging as a fallback for multi-day forecasting
Rounding forecasts to match input data precision (3 decimal places)
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex initial analysis (model comparisons, seasonality assessment) that simplifies to heuristic implementation due to data constraints. Balances statistical awareness with practical execution.
